          javax.swing.JLabel[] playerS

        • roundWinner

          javax.swing.JLabel roundWinner
          The roundWinner JLabel is displayed at the end of each hand to show who played the highest card. The endOfGameWinner is displayed at the end of each game to show which team won the hand.

        • endOfGameWinner

          javax.swing.JLabel endOfGameWinner
          The roundWinner JLabel is displayed at the end of each hand to show who played the highest card. The endOfGameWinner is displayed at the end of each game to show which team won the hand.

        • scoring

          javax.swing.JTable scoring
          The JTable is displayed at the end of each hand with both teams scores. The scored are carried over from hand to hand and the JTable is updated appropriately.

        • play

          javax.swing.JButton play
          Play button starts the game, nextTurn is displayed after each round and starts the next hand when clicked, nextHand is displayed at the end of the hand with the score to go to the next hand and nextPlayerReady is used when there is more than one human to give people time to switch spots so the other person doesn't see any cards but their own

        • nextTurnButton

          javax.swing.JButton nextTurnButton
          Play button starts the game, nextTurn is displayed after each round and starts the next hand when clicked, nextHand is displayed at the end of the hand with the score to go to the next hand and nextPlayerReady is used when there is more than one human to give people time to switch spots so the other person doesn't see any cards but their own

        • nextHand

          javax.swing.JButton nextHand
          Play button starts the game, nextTurn is displayed after each round and starts the next hand when clicked, nextHand is displayed at the end of the hand with the score to go to the next hand and nextPlayerReady is used when there is more than one human to give people time to switch spots so the other person doesn't see any cards but their own

        • nextPlayerReady

          javax.swing.JButton nextPlayerReady
          Play button starts the game, nextTurn is displayed after each round and starts the next hand when clicked, nextHand is displayed at the end of the hand with the score to go to the next hand and nextPlayerReady is used when there is more than one human to give people time to switch spots so the other person doesn't see any cards but their own

        • model

          GUI.MyModel model
          This instantiates the private class MyModel and is used to create the JTable with the proper formatting and values.

        • margin

          java.awt.Insets margin
          This insets object sets the margins for the card buttons so that the button is not larger than the card.

        • constraints

          java.awt.GridBagConstraints constraints
          The GridBagConstraints declared here are used with various GridBagLayouts to properly format displays. They are declared globally because they are changed from different places throughout the code.

        • font

          java.awt.Font font
          The font object is set in the constructor and depends on the screen resolution chosen, larger if higher resolution and smaller if lower resolution. This font is used to set the font for all text throughout the game to make it easy to change all the font without changing it for every object.

        • horizontalHandIcon

          javax.swing.ImageIcon horizontalHandIcon
          These ImageIcons are used to display the face down hand images of cards within JLabels. They are updated as cards are played and their size depends on the screen resolution chosen.

        • verticalHandIcon

          javax.swing.ImageIcon verticalHandIcon
          These ImageIcons are used to display the face down hand images of cards within JLabels. They are updated as cards are played and their size depends on the screen resolution chosen.

        • horizontalHandImage

          java.awt.Image horizontalHandImage
          These Image objects are used to manipulate the size of the images displayed as the size depends on the screen resolution chosen.

        • bgColor

          java.awt.Color bgColor
          The color is used to set the initial background color with the setBackgroundColor method. Declared in the constructor and green by default.

        • myHand0

          java.util.ArrayList<E> myHand0
          The ArrayLists of CardButton objects are used when the respective players are Humans. They hold the CardButtons for all the card in the players hands.

        • playedCards

          java.util.ArrayList<E> playedCards
          The playedCards ArrayList stores cards played for each round in the order of South player in 0, West player in 1, North player in 2 and East player in 3. MiddlePile stores the same cards but in the order that they are played, since this order changes every round. We use two different orders because for some methods it is easier to work with if the cards are in the order that they are played, such as for Bot's playCard method, but for determining the winner of the round, it is important to know who played which card.

        • middlePile

          java.util.ArrayList<E> middlePile
          The playedCards ArrayList stores cards played for each round in the order of South player in 0, West player in 1, North player in 2 and East player in 3. MiddlePile stores the same cards but in the order that they are played, since this order changes every round. We use two different orders because for some methods it is easier to work with if the cards are in the order that they are played, such as for Bot's playCard method, but for determining the winner of the round, it is important to know who played which card.

        • winner

          Card winner
          Holds the Card value returned by the determineWinner method called after each round and used in conjunction with the playedCards array list to determine which player played the winning card.

        • driver

          Driver driver
          Creates a driver object which helps control some of the game play flow.

        • spadesPlayed

          boolean spadesPlayed
          Used by the playableCard method. Is true once spades have been played during a round so the game knows whether or not to allow a player to lead with spades.
